security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only meta-tool skill for token budget planning. The skill contains JavaScript code examples for algorithmic calculations and bash commands for claude-flow memory/hooks integration. No executable scripts, no direct filesystem access beyond documented memory operations, and no network calls beyond standard tool invocations. All operations are transparent, documented, and use standard tool APIs.

content.user_title: Optimize Token Budget with AI Advisor
content.value_statement: Large tasks often exceed token limits, causing failures and wasted work. This skill proactively analyzes your token budget, estimates task complexity, and creates chunked execution plans to complete work successfully within limits.
actual_capabilities: Analyze current token usage against limits with 15% safety buffer
Estimate task complexity using type-based algorithms and multipliers
Generate intelligent chunking strategies for multi-phase execution
Create step-by-step execution plans with checkpoints and tracking
Optimize priorities based on critical path and dependency analysis
Provide contingency plans for budget overruns
limitations: Does not directly reduce token consumption - works with prompt optimization skill
Estimates are probabilistic and may vary by task complexity
Requires accurate current token usage input for best results
Cannot prevent budget exhaustion from unexpected complexity

use_cases.title: Complete Large Features
use_cases.description: Plan and execute multi-phase feature development without hitting token limits mid-task

use_cases.title: Resource Planning
use_cases.description: Estimate token requirements for project planning and team coordination across sessions

use_cases.title: Coordinate Agent Work
use_cases.description: Orchestrate multiple AI agents with shared budget constraints and checkpoint tracking

prompt_templates.title: Quick Budget Check
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to [task description]. Current token usage is [X] out of [limit]. Will this fit in my remaining budget?

prompt_templates.title: Create Execution Plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a token budget execution plan for building [project description]. Current usage: [X] tokens. Budget limit: [Y] tokens.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-Phase Planning
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze [complex task] and generate a 4-phase chunking strategy. Estimated complexity: [X] tokens. Available: [Y] tokens.

prompt_templates.title: Budget Recovery
prompt_templates.prompt: My task exceeded its [X] token estimate at [Y] tokens remaining. Re-plan remaining chunks with 15% safety buffer.

output_examples.input: Build a REST API for user management. Current usage: 45000 tokens. Budget limit: 200000 tokens.

best_practices: Always maintain 15% safety buffer when planning chunk sizes
Use checkpoints after each chunk to track actual vs estimated usage
Defer low-priority work when approaching budget warning thresholds
Store execution plans in memory for multi-session continuity
anti_patterns: Starting large tasks without first assessing token budget
Ignoring budget warnings at 75%+ usage threshold
Skipping checkpoints that make recovery from overruns difficult
Attempting monolithic execution when chunking is clearly needed

faq.question: Which platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: Compatible with Claude, Claude Code, and Codex for token budget planning and task management workflows.

faq.question: What token limits does this skill handle?
faq.answer: Designed for standard 200K token sessions. Adapts to custom limits by adjusting the limit parameter in budget calculations.

faq.question: How does it integrate with other tools?
faq.answer: Uses claude-flow hooks and memory storage. Works with prompt-optimization-analyzer for token reduction strategies.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only analyzes token metrics and creates plans. No data is sent to external services beyond standard tool APIs.

faq.question: Why do my estimates differ from actual usage?
faq.answer: Estimates are probabilistic. Factors like code complexity, testing requirements, and iteration cycles affect actual token consumption.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual planning?
faq.answer: Provides algorithmic consistency with complexity multipliers, dependency analysis, and automatic checkpoint generation that manual planning lacks.
